t: Safety of Abiding in the Presence of God
He*pn who dwells in the secret place of the Most High Shall*ld abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
I*ld will say of the Lord,*s “He*i is*i my refuge and my fortress; My*ld God, in Him I will trust.”
Surely*ln He shall deliver you from the snare of the fowler And*ild from the perilous pestilence.
He*ld shall cover you with His feathers, And*ld under His wings you shall take refuge; His*ld truth shall*i be*i your*i shield and buckler.
You*ld shall not be afraid of the terror by night, Nor*ild of the arrow that*i flies by day,
Nor*ild of the pestilence that*i walks in darkness, Nor*ild of the destruction that*i lays waste at noonday.
A*ln thousand may fall at your side, And*ld ten thousand at your right hand; But*ild it shall not come near you.
Only*ld with your eyes shall you look, And*ld see the reward of the wicked.
Because*ln you have made the Lord,*s who*i is*i my refuge, Even*ild the Most High, your dwelling place,
No*ld evil shall befall you, Nor*ld shall any plague come near your dwelling;
For*ld He shall give His angels charge over you, To*ld keep you in all your ways.
In*ld their*i hands they shall bear you up, Lest*ld you dash your foot against a stone.
You*ld shall tread upon the lion and the cobra, The*ld young lion and the serpent you shall trample underfoot.
“Because*ln he has set his love upon Me, therefore I will deliver him; I*ld will set him on high, because he has known My name.
He*ld shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I*ld will*i be*i with him in trouble; I*ld will deliver him and honor him.
With*ld long life I will satisfy him, And*ld show him My salvation.”
